[[Image:Efez Celsus Library 3 RB.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Personification]] of wisdom (in [[Greek Language|Greek]], "''Σοφία''" or "''[[Sophia (wisdom)|Sophia]]''") at the [[Celsus Library]] in [[Ephesos]], [[Turkey]].]]
+
[[Image:Efez Celsus Library 3 RB.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Personification]] of wisdom (in [[Greek language|Greek]], "''Σοφία''" or "''[[Sophia (wisdom)|Sophia]]''") at the [[Celsus Library]] in [[Ephesus]], [[Turkey]].]]
     
'''Wisdom''' is having gained [[knowledge]], [[experience]], and [[Intuition (knowledge)|intuitive]] [[understanding]], along with a capacity to apply these qualities well. It is the judicious application of knowledge.{{fact}} To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings. The status of wisdom or [[prudence]] as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosophical]] and [[religious]] sources.
 
'''Wisdom''' is having gained [[knowledge]], [[experience]], and [[Intuition (knowledge)|intuitive]] [[understanding]], along with a capacity to apply these qualities well. It is the judicious application of knowledge.{{fact}} To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings.
